title: Maresca short on Sterling sympathy, Arsenal make boardroom reshuffle: football – live
summary: Join our writers for the latest news, previews, and commentary as we approach the weekend. Stay informed with updates on current events and insightful analysis. Don't miss out on what's happening!

title: World Athletics Championships 2025: Lyles and Jefferson-Wooden take 200m titles, Benjamin and Bol win 400m hurdles – live
summary: Yara El-Shaboury will provide updates from Tokyo on the seventh night of events, featuring the highly anticipated men’s and women’s 200m finals. This evening promises exciting athletic competition as top contenders vie for medals. Stay tuned for the latest results and highlights.

title: Scottish minister Jamie Hepburn quits after Douglas Ross assault accusation
summary: Former Scottish Tory leader claims he was grabbed by SNP's John Hepburn during a dispute regarding the party's lack of action on seagull attacks. The incident reportedly occurred amid rising concerns about the issue in Scotland. The allegations highlight ongoing tensions between the parties over wildlife management.

title: Nato confirms it intercepted Russian aircraft over Estonia as EU calls violation a ‘dangerous provocation’ – Europe live
summary: NATO's spokesperson criticized Russia's "reckless behavior" after three Mig-31 fighters violated Estonian airspace for 12 minutes. The incident raised concerns about regional security and aggressive military actions. NATO reaffirmed its commitment to protect its member states against such violations.

title: Israel army says it will use ‘unprecedented force’ in Gaza City and urges residents to leave – as it happened
summary: The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) have instructed residents of Gaza City to evacuate to the south for safety. However, they have also closed the Sala al-Din road, which was a key evacuation route. This has raised concerns about the feasibility of safe escape for those trying to flee the area.
